720479f.title: Manhattan: Hudson Street - Beach Street
720479f.text:
Hudson Street, east side, between Ericsson Place (Beach Street) and Laight Street, showing the frieze and entablature atop the St. Johns Park Freight Terminal of the New York Central Railroad Company. This structure, erected 1868 by the Hudson River Railroad (chartered 1846 and consolidated into the New York Central and Hudson Railroad in 1869), occupies the land that was formerly St. Johns Park. Facing St. Johns Chapel on Varick Street, it provided a picturescue
setting. The spire of the Chapel appears at the top.
Aboat 1890
Ewing Galloway
Neg N. 129
720479f.folder: Hudson Street & Beach Street, Manhattan, NY

720478f-a.title: Manhattan: Hudson Street - Beach Street
720478f-a.text:
Hhudson Street, north from Ericsson Place (Beach Street). Across clearance on the east side, appears Laight Street, north side, east from
Hudson, to, but not including Varick Street.
November 27, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.

716618f.text:
38 Reach Street, south side, east of Hudson Street.
June 1:, 1913.

Salem, Mass.

720477f-b.title: Manhattan: Hudson Street - Beach Street
720477f-b.text:
Budson Street, north from Beach Street (Ericsson Place), showing the St. John's Freight Depot of the New York Central Railroad extending northward on the east side, to Laight Street. This building was rased in 1936. Beach Street, east of Hudson to Varick Street, becomes Ericsson Place.
October 25, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, showing the west side of Hudson Street.
October 10, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.
720477f-b.folder: Hudson Street & Beach Street, Manhattan, NY
